Nic McPhee wrote:
>We're using JUnit to test a evolutionary computation system where many
>(most?) of the methods are directly or indirectly stochastic (use
>random number generation).

Can't you use a standard seed for testing? That way the results would be
definite and predictable. Or you could simply create a mock random number
generator that is not random at all, but simply returns all possible values
in order so that testing can be predictable and exercises all possible
values.

Regards,
Mike
subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing stochastic (random) methods
